official_title: A bill to provide for testing for the use, in violation of law or Federal regulation, of alcohol or controlled substances by persons who operate trains.
subjects: Treatment and rehabilitation of narcotic addicts

summary.text: Railroad Employee Testing Act of 1991 - Amends the Federal Railroad Safety Act of 1970 to require the Secretary of Transportation to issue regulations and standards that require: (1) railroads to conduct preemployment, reasonable suspicion, random, and post-accident testing of railroad employees responsible for safety-sensitive functions for use, in violation of Federal law, of alcohol or a controlled substance; (2) disqualification for a period of time or dismissal of employees found to have used or have been impaired by such alcohol or substances; and (3) rehabilitation programs for the treatment of such employees.
